topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a5a0c56368726704000d29#post_55a5a0c56368726704000d29
It's possible if you have two portals connected to each other with one end traveling at a much faster rate. . . . It's just a really fucking bad idea to do so because as far as we know there's no evidence of parallel timelines so time travel would be a metaphorical bitch to not fuck up.

If you travel back to before you are born then chances are you would wipe yourself from existence entirely.  You would also only be able to travel to times that the portal is connected to.

topics.body:
"@Albus Fahrenheits":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a5a2ca636872100f000153#post_55a5a2ca636872100f000153
[bq="Albus Fahrenheits"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a5a1b8636872676a000d73#post_55a5a1b8636872676a000d73
You mean a wormhole? Yeah, that'd work I think. If one end stay put and the other end travels at extreme speed into the future, this might work. Only if we can generate a wormhole big enough that is.[/bq]
I just remembered one thing.

Imagine holding up a microphone to the amp it connected to. A sound comes out of the amp and the to the microphone and a cycle is created. This results in that high pitched sound you hear when you do this. Eventually, it will become so intense that it blows your amps.

Now imagine the 'wormhole scenario of my previous post. I think the same thing would happen only instead of sound we get radiation. Radiation from the future will travel back into the past. Then to the future until your time machine blows up.
